title: Intracerebral hemorrhage
summary: Intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH), also known as cerebral bleed, intraparenchymal bleed, and hemorrhagic stroke, or haemorrhagic stroke, is a sudden bleeding into the tissues of the brain, into its ventricles, or into both.[3][4][1] It is one kind of bleeding within the skull[3] and one kind of stroke.[4] Symptoms can include headache, one-sided weakness, vomiting, seizures, decreased level of consciousness, and neck stiffness.[2] Often, symptoms get worse over time.[1] Fever is also common.[1]
